trial_identification.studytitle: Respiratory muscle strength, body posture, vocal intensity and maximum phonation times in Parkinson´s disease
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Respiratory muscle strength, body posture, vocal intensity and maximum phonation times in Parkinson´s disease

interventions.interventions: Check the findings of respiratory muscular strength (RMS), body posture (BP), vocal intensity (VI) and maximum phonation time (MPT), in patients with Parkinson´s Disease (PD) and control cases, in according to sex, Parkinson Disease stage (PD) and the level of physical activity (PA). All these factors were assessed on one single day
interventions.comparator: Three men and two women with PD, between 36 and 63 years old (study cases SC), and five individuals without neurologic diseases, of the same age, sex and PA level (control cases CC); RMS, BP, VI and MPT.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Maximum phonation time (MPT) was measured by digital stopwatch.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: All samples were collected three times each on assessment. It was chosen the most valuable.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Respiratory muscle strength was measured using the digital manometer.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Each airway pressure was measured three to five times on assessment, being selected the most value.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Assessment of body posture was performed by a physical therapist collaboratively research.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This assessment was made on the assessment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Vocal intensity was performed using a digital decibel.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Neurological diagnosis of Parkinson's disease (PD), female and male, between 35 and 65 years, speakers of Brazilian Portuguese (BP)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Cognitive deficits, abnormalities in laryngological assessment, not the changes typical of PD and laryngeal or aging; spirometric signs or symptoms of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; be performing speech processing and / or physical therapy; be professional voice, be smoked and / or consume alcohol in excess, hearing loss, singing in choirs.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Check the findings of respiratory muscular strength (RMS), body posture (BP), vocal intensity (VI) and maximum phonation time (MPT), in patients with Parkinson´s Disease (PD) and control cases, in according to sex, Parkinson Disease stage (PD) and the level of physical activity (PA).

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comite de Etica em Pesquisa Universidade Federal de Santa Maria
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Avenida Roraima, 1000 - Predio da Reitoria - 7o andar - Sala 702 Cidade Universitaria - Bairro Camobi 97105-900 - Santa Maria - RS
